  • Field Details

    • HIGHLIGHT_CANVAS

      public static final int HIGHLIGHT_CANVAS
      Repaint only the highlight canvas. This canvas shows overlay marks etc.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FRONT_CANVAS

      public static final int FRONT_CANVAS
      Repaint the front canvas. This usually shows all detections
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BASE_CANVAS

      public static final int BASE_CANVAS
      Repaint the back canvas. This shows things like 2D plots e.g. the spectrogram
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ALL_CANVAS

      public static final int ALL_CANVAS
      Repaint all canvas
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • repaint

      public void repaint()
      Repaints all the canvas, including all data units

    • repaint

      public void repaint(long tm, int flag)
      Repaint all canvases in the plot pane. There are multiple canvases which are layered to avoid issue with say a spectrogram painting over the data units. The flag is a bitmap of which canvases to paint, all or perhaps just the canvas which highlights annotated detections in order to save time.
      Parameters:
      tm - - minimum time in millis since last repaint. If the time since least repaint is less than this then
      flag - - the type flag for the canvas that is to be painted.

    • repaintMarks

      public void repaintMarks()
      Repaints only the marks on the canvas and highlighted data units. This speeds up marking graphics.

    • getBaseCanvas

      public javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas getBaseCanvas()
      Get the base canvas.
      Returns:
      the base canvas.

    • getChannels

      public int getChannels()
      Get the channels shown on the display.
      Returns:
      the channels shown on the display.

    • getExtraInfo

      public MarkExtraInfo getExtraInfo()
      Specified by:
      getExtraInfo in interface MarkExtraInfoSource
      Returns:
      extra information about the mark being made from the panel (FX or Swing) that is making it.

    • getTDGraph

      public TDGraphFX getTDGraph()
      Get the TDGraph the TDPlotPane belongs to.
      Returns:
      the TDGraphFX whihc owns the plot pane.
